Detailed Description

Wrapper class for any kind of class.

Any allows you to wrap any kind of class in it, in other words, it acts as an universal supertype. It is similar to what void* was used in C, but safer to use (wrong casts return a null pointer instead of a corrupted pointer). Any is useful for using in collections, it will allow any kind of object to be stored in a single collection. Other languages or toolkits use a superclass for this purpose, (e.g. Object), but this does not take primitive or alien (i.e. from another API) types into account. Any can be used safely for such purposes and is recommended over void* or Object.

An example of a predefined collection using Any is Dictionary, which acts as a HashMap of String,Any.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Sylph::Any::Any (  )  [inline]

Creates a new, empty Any object.

The internal pointer will be initialized to NULL.

template<class T >
Sylph::Any::Any ( const T &  value  )  [inline]

Creates a new Any object from an existing object.

The object will be copied, therefore it is advised you only use easy-to-copy data, such as primitives, reference counted data, or pointers.

Note: Any will not take ownership over pointers.

Parameters:
value The value the new instance of Any will point to.

Sylph::Any::Any ( const Any &  other  )  [inline]

Copies this Any object from another Any object.

The internal pointer will be copied to this new Any object.

Member Function Documentation

bool Sylph::Any::empty (  )  [inline]

Check if this Any is pointing to something.

Returns:
true if the internal pointer is a NULL pointer, false otherwise.

template<class T >
Any& Sylph::Any::operator= ( T &  value  )  [inline]

Assigns a new value to this Any.

Again, the value can be of any type, and is not restricted by the type that had been before in the Any. The internal data pointer gets completely replaced by a new one, pointing to the new data.

Parameters:
value A new value for the Any to point to.
Returns:
The current any, with the updated data pointer.

Any& Sylph::Any::operator= ( const Any &  rhs  )  [inline]

Assigns an other Any instance to this one.

The assignment simply consists of copying the internal data pointer to this Any.

Parameters:
rhs An other Any instance to copy the data pointer from.
Returns:
The current Any, modified to be equal to the other Any.

const std::type_info& Sylph::Any::type (  )  const [inline]

Gets the typeinfo of the data pointed to.

The result returned is compatible with the return value of the typeid operator, which means that you can check if the Any can be casted to a type using its typeid. E.g: 

 if(myany.type() == typeid(int) {
     // safe to cast to int here
 } else {
     // give some error message about the wrong type
 }
If the internal data pointer is a NULL pointer, it will return the typeid of void.

Friends And Related Function Documentation

template<class T >
T* any_cast ( Any &  any  )  [friend]

Cast an Any to the type it is holding.

This cast is completely safe, and either returns a correct pointer, or completely fails.

Parameters:
any An Any to convert to an instance of the type it is representing
Returns:
A pointer to the internal data of the Any if the conversion was successful, NULL otherwise.
